name: 英語小組討論
restrict: ◎限外系修習    ◎第一階段限 榮譽英語學程 ◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description: 本課旨在培養並訓練學生以流暢正確之英語有效率地進行小組座談式(panel)之討論，學生就指定之議題，先行充分收集資料，在判斷並決定個人立場之後，於上課時在指定時間內做深入之討論。本課同時亦將搭配校內不定期舉辦之英語演說，安排學生聆聽演講並進行即席討論(lecture-forum)。
goals: 強化學生英語文閱讀、聆聽的策略與能力，協助獲取專業領域新知
提昇英語文口語、寫作的表達能力，期盼學生能於工作職場及學術研究領域展現英語專業涵養
協助學生深入瞭解國際社會的多元文化，培養國際觀，對特定文化現象進行分析、比較，激發學生之批判性思考能力。
syllabus:
**English Discussion Course** 

                                                                                                                             **Fall Semester, 2020** 

**Course Objectives:**

This course aims to enhance students’ English language proficiency, communication competence and interpersonal skills in order to work effectively and constructively in small group discussions. More specifically, the course will provide students with extensive language practices and many speaking interactions that will help them to express their opinions and build effective oral communication skills. In particular, through the case studies of controversial issues presented in class, students will engage in discussions that require their critical analysis and active participations. In sum, from the course, students will (1). learn to work productively in team discussions (2).gain practical experiences in leading and participating in small group discussions and (3).develop their speaking competency in English.  
  
Grading Basis and Course Requirements:  
  
(1). Attendance and discussion preparation - (15%): Students are expected to attend the class well prepared for the assigned discussion units in Discussion Starter. Please note that if you have more than two unexcused absences, your grade might be in danger. In addition, tardiness and absences will affect your final grade. (If you want an excused absence, you should try to inform the instructor beforehand and submit a “note of absence” to the instructor afterwards.)  
  
(2). Discussion leading - (20%): Each individual student will be required to lead four discussions in total during this semester. These discussions will be theme-based and we will spend 2 weeks on each subject. Students are responsible for the reading materials and discussion questions, and prepare enough printouts for their group members (make sure to cite your references). The materials for each discussion leading should be submitted to the instructor one week before the designated date.  
  
(3). Weekly journal entries (20%): Students are required to write a short journal entry each week (between 1/2 page to 1 page double-spaced). In your journals, you could include the observations that you have made or new things that you have learned during our in-class group discussions.  
  
(4). Reflection essay (5%): You have to submit a 3-page (double spaced) reflection paper. The paper should reflect your overall learning experience in this class.  
  
(5). Participation (10%): This course requires students to make effective and active participations in group discussions. Therefore, students' contributions in these discussions will be evaluated by their peers.  
  
(6). Mid-term and Final Exams (15% each)
